reviews.review_msg: one of the best profs at sfu.  very enthusiastic about his subject, knows his material very well, responds to your e-mail asap.  assignments are difficult but exam is fair
The best math I have ever had. All the math prof should be like him. Clear and organized lecture, fair homework and exams. Take with him and you will like him! 100% recommended.

I took Math 302 with Jamie in Fall 2016. This was HANDS DOWN the greatest class I have ever taken in my schooling career. Jamie has a clear passion for mathematics, and for those who share this passion, being taught by him is an honour in itself. The class went into high detail and analyzation in permutation puzzles including the Rubiks Cube.
Very clear in lectures. Cares about the students.
Overall good prof. He taught rubiks cube in high interest level. Lec are not that boring as usual math courses. Fair exams and hw.
His lectures are very organized. Explain everything clearly. His accent is not a big problem, you will get used to it quickly. Best prof!
He cares about students and it seems like he puts a lot of effort into teaching . He doesn't make things easy; expect long homeworks. Take his course if you want to really learn math.

Worst experience in my undergrad career.  He's assignments are long , tedious and NOT ENOUGH for preparing exams. He's tests are not designed to be finished in time. He gives no example in lecture, yet no textbook. Take he's class as your elective if you feel your current classes aren't challenging enough.

Not bad. He is always nervous. Final were similar to the practice final. Study practice final to prepare. Try talk to him if you are not doing good in class, he could help you by looking through your progress. Seldom reply email, find him in person.

Super nice Prof, I recommend. However some of the proofs in this course might be hard to figure out on your own in a short time frame, so you might not want to cram half the course in a day or two if u want a really good grade

Veselin Jungic is the most caring, supportive professor I've ever had. He genuinely wants his students to enjoy the class. The lectures were complex and the assignments were tough but you learn the tricks to solving them in class. The group project had lots of freedom and was fun. The exam was extremely fair. I hope Dr. J. has a great retirement!
